skill.name: docs-creator
skill.description: Create and organize public documentation pages using Fumadocs. Use when building new documentation pages or organizing existing ones.
skill.summary: Build structured documentation with Fumadocs MDX pages, automatic routing, and icon support
skill.author: AayushBaniya2006

security_audit.summary: This skill is safe for publication. All 47 static findings are false positives from the analyzer misinterpreting Markdown syntax as code. The skill contains only documentation and reference materials with no executable code, network requests, or file system operations.

content.value_statement: Building technical documentation requires consistent structure and routing. This skill helps you create well-organized MDX documentation pages with Fumadocs, handling frontmatter, navigation metadata, and icon integration automatically.
actual_capabilities: Create MDX documentation pages with proper frontmatter structure
Generate meta.json files for controlling sidebar navigation and folder organization
Configure page metadata including titles, descriptions, and Lucide icons
Organize nested documentation hierarchies with automatic URL routing
Reference Fumadocs UI components like Callout, Tabs, and Steps in MDX content
limitations: Requires Fumadocs to be already installed and configured in the project
Only works with the specific file structure pattern in src/content/docs/
Cannot modify Fumadocs configuration or customize rendering behavior
Does not validate that referenced Lucide icon names exist

use_cases.title: API Documentation Structure
use_cases.description: Create a complete API reference section with endpoint documentation, authentication guides, and code examples organized in a logical hierarchy.

use_cases.title: Product Documentation
use_cases.description: Build user-facing help documentation with getting started guides, feature walkthroughs, and troubleshooting sections with proper navigation.

use_cases.title: Internal Knowledge Base
use_cases.description: Organize team documentation including onboarding guides, architecture decisions, and development workflows in a searchable structure.

prompt_templates.title: Create Basic Documentation Page
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a getting started page at src/content/docs/getting-started.mdx with title Getting Started and description Quick start guide for new users
prompt_templates.scenario: Starting a new documentation section with a simple introductory page

prompt_templates.title: Build API Reference Section
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an API folder in docs with a meta.json that organizes pages for authentication, endpoints, and webhooks with the Webhook icon
prompt_templates.scenario: Structuring comprehensive API documentation with multiple related pages

prompt_templates.title: Add Nested Documentation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a guides/advanced folder with meta.json and add pages for caching, performance, and security with appropriate icons
prompt_templates.scenario: Building a multi-level documentation hierarchy for complex topics

prompt_templates.title: Organize Existing Pages
prompt_templates.prompt: Update the meta.json in src/content/docs to reorder pages putting introduction first, then installation, configuration, and add a separator before advanced topics
prompt_templates.scenario: Reorganizing documentation navigation after adding multiple pages

output_examples.input: Create a troubleshooting page with the AlertCircle icon
output_examples.output: I created src/content/docs/troubleshooting.mdx with frontmatter containing title: Troubleshooting, description: Common issues and solutions, and icon: AlertCircle. The page is now accessible at /docs/troubleshooting.

output_examples.input: Set up a components section with meta.json organizing button, form, and modal pages
output_examples.output: I created src/content/docs/components/meta.json with title: UI Components, icon: Package, and pages array containing button, form, and modal. The section will appear in the sidebar with proper ordering.

best_practices: Always include title and description in MDX frontmatter for SEO and search functionality
Use descriptive Lucide icon names that match the content topic to improve visual navigation
Organize related pages into folders with meta.json to maintain clear documentation hierarchy
anti_patterns: Creating pages without frontmatter will result in missing metadata and poor search indexing
Using non-existent Lucide icon names will cause rendering errors in the sidebar
Placing pages outside src/content/docs/ will break the Fumadocs routing system

faq.question: What file format should documentation pages use?
faq.answer: Use MDX format with .mdx extension. MDX allows you to combine Markdown with React components from Fumadocs UI.

faq.question: How do I control the order of pages in the sidebar?
faq.answer: Create a meta.json file in the folder and list page filenames in the desired order in the pages array.

faq.question: Can I use custom icons for documentation sections?
faq.answer: You can use any Lucide icon name. Reference the Lucide icon library at lucide.dev to find available icon names.

faq.question: Where should I place documentation images and assets?
faq.answer: The skill focuses on page structure and metadata. Asset placement depends on your Fumadocs configuration, typically in a public or static folder.

faq.question: How do nested folders affect the URL structure?
faq.answer: Folders create URL segments automatically. For example, api/auth.mdx becomes /docs/api/auth in the browser.

faq.question: Does this skill modify existing Fumadocs configuration?
faq.answer: No, this skill only creates content pages and navigation metadata. It assumes Fumadocs is already installed and configured in your project.
